item.title: Documentation timeouts

Sep 15, 21:21 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Sep 15, 18:11 UTC
Investigating - We're currently investigating an increased rate of timeout on docs.fivem.net

Jul 4, 07:03 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jul 4, 06:19 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jul 4, 06:18 UTC
Scheduled - We're updating the forums to the latest version of Discourse.

item.title: Cloudflare outage
item.description:
Jun 21, 08:12 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jun 21, 07:17 UTC
Monitoring - Some regions are back online, player count is now ramping up.

Jun 21, 06:45 UTC
Identified - Cloudflare is currently experiencing a widespread outage. Some of our services might be unavailable for the time being.
You can get more information about this outage at https://cloudflare.statuspage.io/incidents/xvs51y9qs9dj

item.title: Notice: DNS configuration
item.description:
Jun 2, 21:10 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jun 2, 08:47 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Jun 2, 08:46 UTC
Update - Update to change status in UI. Nothing has changed.

Jun 2, 08:45 UTC
Monitoring - Some ISPs accidentally cached a DNS entry with a long TTL. If you're getting 'Could not connect to backend services' or 'No Heartbeat received', please switch your DNS to another server such as https://1.1.1.1/dns/ or similar.

This issue can't be resolved by us as we do not control your ISP nor their DNS servers. It will also clear itself within the next day.

item.title: Authentication issues
item.description:
May 26, 18:51 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

May 26, 18:08 UTC
Monitoring - The issue has been identified and a fix has been deployed. We are now monitoring the results.

May 26, 17:59 UTC
Investigating - We're currently investigating issues with our authentication service which affect some of our users.

May 21, 12:46 UTC

item.title: Keymaster UI: Cloudflare CAPTCHA issue
item.description:
May 5, 18:12 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

May 5, 14:48 UTC
Monitoring - Cloudflare has an issue with their CAPTCHA and this is affecting some people trying to log in to the Keymaster web interface, getting stuck on Please stand by, while we are checking your browser....

We'll remove this message when this is resolved.

item.title: CnL connectivity issue
item.description:
May 3, 16:00 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

May 3, 15:16 UTC
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

May 3, 15:15 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

May 3, 15:10 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Intermittent CnL connectivity issue
item.description:
May 3, 00:22 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

May 3, 00:05 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

May 2, 23:57 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Potential CnL outage due to maintenance
item.description:
May 2, 10:40 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Everything seems to work correctly, and the intermittent outages (due to QUIC being used instead of HTTP/2 over TCP) have been resolved by disabling QUIC on the Cloudflare tunnel.

May 2, 09:44 UTC
Verifying - The switchover has completed and only a small amount of people seem to have cached the NXDOMAIN - most people are fine! We'll continue monitoring the new routing setup for now.

May 2, 09:40 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

May 2, 09:38 UTC
Scheduled - We're moving CnL to a new routing backend, This'll likely induce some DNS issues for the time being.

item.title: Service outage
item.description:
May 1, 19:38 UTC
Resolved - The DNS cache threshold seems to have passed, and everything is back online.

May 1, 18:57 UTC
Monitoring - Everything is back online as per usual. Some users may experience DNS issues due to Cloudflare's NXDOMAIN time-to-live, this should resolve itself in around an hour (at 19:33 UTC, or if changing DNS servers to use a known public DNS with an explicit cache flushing policy).

Underlying cause seems to be a brief influx of 2-3x the usual load leading to a cluster-wide failure, and performance optimization done last week does not seem to mitigate the initial issue (but does help with recovery, as the oft-hated 'bucket system' was not needed anymore).

Our suspicion is that this load influx is a result of server owners doing 'scheduled restarts' of their servers at full hours (in this case, 18:00 UTC, a particularly nasty time), and this leads to a thundering herd-style scenario of both clients as well as servers reauthenticating with our services, failing, retrying (albeit often manually), and eventually overloading some unknown backend system.

May 1, 18:09 UTC
Investigating - We're currently investigating issues with some of our services. Please remain patient.

item.title: Services issues
item.description:
Apr 24, 16:58 UTC
Resolved - Services are back online. A higher-than-usual load for this time of week triggered a known failure scenario that was scheduled for a fix next week. Outage took longer than it should've as it was interpreted as a different failure scenario.

Apr 24, 16:55 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Apr 24, 16:46 UTC
Investigating - We are aware of issues with some of our services and are investigating.

item.title: CnL outage
item.description:
Apr 15, 21:25 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

The issue has been deduced to an unknown-cause Redis restart that did not correctly reconnect in an app that consumes data from this Redis cluster.

Apr 15, 21:02 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating an outage on CnL that seems to have been induced by a load blip.

item.title: Network incident
item.description:
Apr 5, 20:39 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Apr 5, 19:46 UTC
Update - We are still monitoring, but all players should now be able to connect.

Apr 5, 18:49 UTC
Monitoring - The network outage seems to have been resolved. However, DNS seems to have gotten some wrong data cached. This should be fixed in an hour or so depending on your DNS provider.

Apr 5, 18:30 UTC
Investigating - We are aware of yet another network outage similar to the last one. Please stand by.

item.title: CnL Outage
item.description:
Apr 4, 08:27 UTC
Resolved - The nodes have recovered as of a few hours ago and we have re-enabled the functionality that was disabled for performance reasons.

Apr 3, 21:33 UTC
Update - We are still monitoring and waiting for the last nodes to fully recover.

Apr 3, 19:01 UTC
Update - These nodes still remain offline, but DNS cache should have expired and everyone *should* be able to play again.

Apr 3, 17:44 UTC
Monitoring - We have isolated the nodes with faulty networking while we wait for them to recover, and services should now be operational again. DNS cache may take a while to update for some players, but you should be able to join soon!

Apr 3, 16:29 UTC
Investigating - We are currently investigating a network outage affecting CnL.

item.title: Keymaster outage
item.description:
Mar 24, 18:04 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Mar 24, 17:32 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Mar 24, 17:10 UTC
Identified - An upstream provider is having connectivity issues, so Keymaster is currently unavailable. We'll keep you updated.

item.title: Pinned certificate cycling
item.description:
Mar 23, 02:52 UTC
Resolved - This issue has now been resolved. Thanks for your patience.
Please restart your client in order to download the latest client update before trying to connect to servers again.
Have fun playing FiveM & RedM!

Mar 23, 02:27 UTC
Identified - We have identified the issue. We're working on releasing a fix in the next few minutes.

Mar 23, 02:04 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Mar 23, 02:00 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Mar 23, 01:59 UTC
Investigating - We're aware of authentication issues and are investigating.

item.title: Authentication issues
item.description:
Mar 20, 22:54 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Mar 20, 21:05 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate the issue.

Again, we apologize for the recent increase in outages. It should be noted that these arise due to unforeseen circumstances, and we are doing our best to investigate these issues and resolve them.

Mar 20, 17:39 UTC
Update - We've enabled connection buckets to mitigate the load. Waiting time will be gradually reduced for everyone once our infrastructure recovers.

Mar 20, 17:22 UTC
Investigating - We're aware of the authentication issues and are investigating.

item.title: Authentication issues
item.description:
Mar 15, 22:58 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Mar 15, 20:18 UTC
Monitoring - Services recovered, everyone should now be able to connect without issues.
We're now closely monitoring our infrastructure to prevent connection errors from resurfacing again.
Thank you a lot for your patience and have fun playing FiveM! :)

Mar 15, 19:40 UTC
Investigating - We're aware of issues with our authentication service and are currently investigating. Please stand-by

item.title: Authentication issues
item.description:
Mar 14, 23:58 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Mar 14, 22:15 UTC
Monitoring - Infrastructure seems to be recovering. We will thoroughly monitor our services for the upcoming hours to make sure everything remains stable. Thank you a lot for your patience.

Mar 14, 20:59 UTC
Update - We enabled connection buckets to mitigate the load while we're investigating the root cause of the issue. Waiting time will be decreased each time we have sufficient headroom on the infrastructure load. Please remain patient.

Mar 14, 20:42 UTC
Investigating - We are aware of issues while connecting to FiveM and RedM servers, and are investigating.

item.title: Cluster maintenance
item.description:
Mar 14, 06:19 UTC
Completed - While the maintenance has now concluded, we unfortunately were not able to complete it to our satisfaction. We'll come back with a new maintenance slot at a later date.

Mar 14, 06:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 10, 15:30 UTC
Scheduled - We will be performing some maintenance on the cluster at this time, some users may face intermittent connectivity issues.

item.title: Issues with CNL
item.description:
Mar 13, 01:06 UTC
Resolved - This incident has now been resolved.

Mar 12, 21:21 UTC
Monitoring - In order to make sure the incident stays on the status page even if it's responding.

We're monitoring now, apologies for the buckets which will delay your entry into the game. They're necessary to ensure the stability of our services.

item.title: Unhealthy node in the cluster
item.description:
Mar 10, 16:07 UTC
Resolved - This incident is considered resolved, but we will continue monitoring.

Mar 10, 15:27 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and things are looking better now! We have located the issue and will be slotting in a maintenance window soon to attempt a permanent solution.

Mar 10, 15:12 UTC
Identified - We currently have an unhealthy node in our cluster and are working to remediate the issue. Some users may face the occasional connectivity issue while we deploy a fix.
